With more than 20 formal degrees, as well as valuable certification programs, fellowships and residencies, you can explore your interests and find the right program for you.              Prepare for a successful career as a researcher, educator or scientist-practitioner in rehabilitation            PhD in Disability Studies  Examine how addressing disability in its full complexity can promote the full participation, self-determination, and equal citizenship of people with disabilities in society      Take the next step              PhD in Kinesiology and Nutrition  Prepare for a successful career as a researcher, educator or scientist-practitioner. Conduct basic, applied and translational research in a wide range of kinesiology and nutrition settings      Take the next step              PhD Rehabilitation Sciences  Become a researcher, educator, or scientist-practitioner skilled at conducting research in rehabilitation-oriented settings      Take the next step               Stats and Facts     #1  ranked occupational therapy program of all national public universities by U.S. News & World Report         Gateway  Kinesiology prepares students to be experts in human movement, a primer for any health career         1921  year biomedical visualization program was founded, one of four accredited programs of its kind in the nation         Pioneer  The first PhD in the nation dedicated to disability studies         100%  licensure exam pass rates in nutrition, occupational therapy and physical therapy         First  The PhD in rehabilitation sciences is the first of its kind in the state         150  years of combined academic experience among physical therapy faculty         Possibility  Graduates of the online health information management programs are equipped to fill a growing need for trained informaticians         71%  increase in freshman enrollment between 2017-18, 16% increase overall           See all of our  degrees and admission deadlines       Supportive Academic Environment for All        No matter where you’re from, AHS will feel like home. We offer you the encouragement, tools and support you need to succeed in the classroom and after graduation.  UIC is proud to be one of the most ethnically and culturally rich college campuses in America. Our welcoming environment and diverse student body promote deeper learning and new perspectives on life.     Academic Support and Achievement Program    Library of Health Sciences    Student Affairs    Urban Health Program       Learn From the Best            Joy Hammel  Internationally known preeminent scholar on the interaction of disability studies, occupational therapy, and participation in context disparities and promising practices with people who have disabilities      Meet Joy              David Marquez  Member of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services' 2018 Physical Activity Advisory Committee, which includes some of the country's most accomplished physical activity and health experts      Meet David              Sangeetha Madhavan  Awarded a $1.5 million grant from the National Institute of Child Health and Human Development to determine whether brain stimulation combined with gait training can improve patients’ ability to walk after a stroke      Meet Sangeetha              Angela Odoms-Young  Studies the social, cultural and environmental determinants of dietary behaviors and diet-related diseases in low-income and minority populations      Meet Angela              Shane Phillips  Shedding light on the relationship between binge drinking and cardiovascular disease in young adults      Meet Shane              Spyros Kitsiou  Leading the way in mobile health interventions, emerging health information technologies and evidence-based practice in health informatics      Meet Spyros                Recent News    Taking the long view   Wednesday, April 22, 2020     Two IPL researchers are named Fellows of the American Heart Association   Tuesday, April 14, 2020     UIC explores partnership with Tecnológico de Monterrey   Wednesday, April 8, 2020     UIC opens occupational therapy clinic   Thursday, March 12, 2020     Meet the 2020 AHS Alumni Awards recipients   Monday, February 17, 2020      All AHS news     Upcoming Events     May  12   UIC Kinesiology Online ICT Information Session   Tuesday, 12:00 pm -
